abstract.p: Mount Vernon High School basketball star Ben Gordon gives verbal commitment to University of Connecticut; photo (By the Way column) (S)

block.p: The recruiting battle for Ben Gordon, the Mount Vernon High School basketball star, ended last week when the 6-foot-2, 180-pound Gordon gave a verbal commitment to the University of Connecticut.
The recruiting battle for Ben Gordon, the Mount Vernon High School basketball star, ended last week when the 6-foot-2, 180-pound Gordon gave a verbal commitment to the University of Connecticut.
Rated one of the top 20 seniors nationally for the next season, Gordon, a guard, had been heavily recruited by Seton Hall University. Too heavily.
''Two weeks ago I thought I was going to Seton Hall,'' Gordon said, ''but they put a lot of pressure on me.''
UConn, one of the nation's top programs, recruited more casually. And after an unofficial visit to the campus in Storrs, last weekend, Gordon was sold.

Technically, Gordon cannot sign a binding letter of intent until November. Howie Garfinkel, the director of the Five Star Basketball Camp for promising young athletes, said: ''Ben Gordon is as good as anyone in the country. Whatever the program, he'll start right away.''
